channel.title: [PI] Attempting to open my JAR client
channel.description:
Okay, so I have been at this for a little while now and I can't seem to figure out the problem. I JAR everything correctly, but then when attempting to load the .jar file I get a Java exception error and I don't know what to do to fix the error since it doesn't really tell me much of anything. :palm: Here is the error: [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Client (wrong name: com/Client) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . . [/code] It says wrong name, but that is exactly what it is named (uppercase C and not lowercase is correct as well). My environmental variables are all set correctly etc...Any help is much appreciated. Thank you. :) If you need any extra info. please ask and I will post it up ASAP.
Also, while looking into things I noticed most clients have an EGUI or GUI or something of the sort, but mine has neither. Could that maybe be the issue here? I wouldn't think so since the client loads just fine from a batch file and from Eclipse. And if I put the jar client in Eclipse I can run it just fine, but I can't run it outside of Eclipse. :\
I suppose nobody looks to help people out in the Client Help section then :'(.. I attempted to JAR a completely different client just to make sure I was doing it right, and it worked 100% no problems. But the client/source I have been working on for a little while now doesn't want to work correctly. >.< Really frustrated and the problem seems so simple yet can't figure out how to fix or what to do. I tried every little thing I could think of. PLEASE HELP ME.
Fixed this on my own at last, still wish I got help from the community. But maybe with my new found knowledge I can help others with the same problem in the future. :\

item.title: [PI] Attempting to open my JAR client
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

Okay, so I have been at this for a little while now and I can’t seem to figure out the problem.
I JAR everything correctly, but then when attempting to load the .jar file I get a Java exception error and I don’t know what to do to fix the error since it doesn’t really tell me much of anything. :palm:
Here is the error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Client (wrong name: com/Client)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(Unknown Source)
Press any key to continue . . .

It says wrong name, but that is exactly what it is named (uppercase C and not lowercase is correct as well).
My environmental variables are all set correctly etc…Any help is much appreciated. Thank you.
If you need any extra info. please ask and I will post it up ASAP.

Also, while looking into things I noticed most clients have an EGUI or GUI or something of the sort, but mine has neither. Could that maybe be the issue here? I wouldn’t think so since the client loads just fine from a batch file and from Eclipse.
And if I put the jar client in Eclipse I can run it just fine, but I can’t run it outside of Eclipse. :\

I suppose nobody looks to help people out in the Client Help section then :’(…
I attempted to JAR a completely different client just to make sure I was doing it right, and it worked 100% no problems. But the client/source I have been working on for a little while now doesn’t want to work correctly. >.< Really frustrated and the problem seems so simple yet can’t figure out how to fix or what to do. I tried every little thing I could think of. PLEASE HELP ME.

Fixed this on my own at last, still wish I got help from the community. But maybe with my new found knowledge I can help others with the same problem in the future. :\
